section.title: Default behaviour of Git for empty directories
section.para: Git ignores empty directories, i.e., it does not put them under version control.

section.title: Tracking empty directories

indexterm.primary: Tracking an empty directory in Git

section.para: If you want to track an empty directory in your Git repository, it is a good practice to put a file called .gitignore in the directory. As the directory now contains a file, Git includes it into its version control mechanism.

note.para: The file could be called anything. Others sources recommend to call the file .gitkeep . One problem with this approach is that .gitkeep is unlikely to be ignored by build systems, resulting in the .gitkeep file being copied to the output repository.
